column4: I had to update glib to >= 2.5 and, in doing so, removed the standard glib ubuntu package.  Ubuntu didn't like that and now I'm trying to fix it.  Anyone feel up to helping me?
I have a question.  If I install a new version of ubuntu, will my files in /home/ be effected?
depends on how you format
but by default, yes
please explain
the best thing is if /home was on a seperate partition
how do I view my partitions?
you can use fdisk/cfdisk for command line utilities, or use gparted
gparted terminated glib option error
try using cfdisk then to take a look
cfdisk says fatal error: cannot open disk drive
you do know you can't partition a live filesystem right?
that's why it took me so long to respond.... I had to restart my broken 6.06 istall to run cfdisk
and fdisk -l isn't showing anything which is starting to freak me out...
the livecd has gparted on it, and psychocats.net has a great tutorial about how to move your data to a home partition
so reboot live and run gparted?
your main aim is to do a NEW installation while preserving your /home data?
seeing as how I really messed up 6.06, I would like to get a clean install of 6.10 and perserve my /home data yes :)
yes, then boot the livecd and gparted and follow the tutorial (remember pyschocats.net)
I've found pyschocats.net but I haven't found the tutorial you're talking about...
I think I found it now... talking about the backup ubuntu guide?
Beyond The Basics: Make a /home partition http://psychocats.net/ubuntu/separatehome
thanks for your help and I'll get back if I'm having trouble ;)
